Rescheduled thanks to "Alfredo"(winter storm). This means more people can attend with advanced notice.

 

 

Everybody’s Fine (Stanno Tutti Bene), 1990, was directed by Giuseppe Tornatore of Cinema Paradiso fame. The film stars the legendary Italian actor Marcello Mastroianni in a marvelous late performance as a retired Sicilian man, Matteo Scuro. After being disappointed that his five children will not return to Sicily for their annual summer reunion, Matteo decides to travel to the mainland and make surprise visits to them instead.  His trip takes him up the Italian peninsula through Naples, Rome, Florence, Milan and Turin.  The film is a reflection on the realities of parenthood after one’s children have become adults.

 

We will begin the evening with an introduction of the film. After screening the film attendees are welcome to participate in an exchange of ideas and observations. We look forward to seeing you on Friday, November 4th at 7pm.

 

EVENT: Italian Film Series
